universum.studios.android.recycler.decoration

Class RecyclerViewItemDecoration

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ItemDecoration
      • universum.studios.android.recycler.decoration.RecyclerViewItemDecoration
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ItemDividerDecoration, ItemSpaceDecoration

    public abstract class RecyclerViewItemDecoration
extends RecyclerView.ItemDecoration
    A RecyclerView.ItemDecoration implementation that is used as base class by all item decorations from the Recycler library and is also encouraged to be used as base class by custom decoration implementations.

    Xml attributes

    ItemDecoration Attributes

    Default style attribute

    none
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky
    See Also:
    RecyclerView.addItemDecoration(RecyclerView.ItemDecoration)

        public RecyclerViewItemDecoration(@Nullable
                                  Context context,

                                  AttributeSet attrs,

                                  int defStyleAttr,
                                  @StyleRes
                                  int defStyleRes)
        Creates a new instance of RecyclerViewItemDecoration for the given context.
        Parameters:
        context - Context in which will be the new decoration presented.
        attrs - Set of Xml attributes used to configure the new instance of this decoration.
        defStyleAttr - An attribute which contains a reference to a default style resource for this decoration within a theme of the given context.
        defStyleRes - Resource id of the default style for the new decoration.

    • Method Detail

      • setSkipFirst

        public void setSkipFirst(boolean skip)
        Sets a boolean flag indicating whether this decoration should be skipped for the first item from data set of the associated RecyclerView.

        Default value: false

        Parameters:
        skip - True to not apply this decoration for the first item, false to apply it.
        See Also:
        skipsFirst(), setSkipLast(boolean)

      • skipsFirst

        public boolean skipsFirst()
        Checks whether this decoration is skipped for the first item.
        Returns:
        True if this decoration is not applied for the first item, false if it is.
        See Also:
        setSkipFirst(boolean)

      • setSkipLast

        public void setSkipLast(boolean skip)
        Sets a boolean flag indicating whether this decoration should be skipped for the last item from data set of the associated RecyclerView.

        Default value: false

        Parameters:
        skip - True to not apply this decoration for the last item, false to apply it.
        See Also:
        skipsFirst(), setSkipFirst(boolean)

      • skipsLast

        public boolean skipsLast()
        Checks whether this decoration is skipped for the last item.
        Returns:
        True if this decoration is not applied for the last item, false if it is.
        See Also:
        setSkipLast(boolean)

      • shouldDecorate

        protected boolean shouldDecorate(@NonNull
                                 RecyclerView parent,
                                 @NonNull
                                 RecyclerView.State state)
        Checks whether any subsequent decoration algorithm should be applied by this decoration for the given parent RecyclerView and its current state.

        This implementation checks whether the given RecyclerView has its RecyclerView.LayoutManager specified by RecyclerView.getLayoutManager() != null and if there are any items to be decorated by RecyclerView.State.getItemCount() > 0. If both conditions are met, this method returns true, if not, false is returned.

        Parameters:
        parent - The RecyclerView into which is this decoration added.
        state - Current state of the parent RecyclerView.
        Returns:
        True if decorating should be performed, false otherwise.
